sen.j: 京極宮家仁親王（きょうごくのみや やかひとしんのう、宝永元年4月1日 （1704年5月4日） - 明和4年12月6日 （1768年1月25日））は江戸時代中期の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Yakahito (May 4, 1704 - January 25, 1768) was the Japanese Imperial family in the middle of Edo period.
Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Yakahito (May 4, 1704 - January 25, 1768) was a Japanese Imperial family member in the middle of the Edo period.
Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Yakahito (May 4, 1704 - January 25, 1768) was a Japanese Imperial family member in the middle of the Edo period.
He was the eighth Kyogokunomiya. (Katsuranomiya)
He was the eighth Kyogokunomiya. (Katsuranomiya)
He was the eighth Kyogokunomiya (Katsuranomiya).

sen.j: 京極宮文仁親王の第1王子。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Ayahito.
He was the first Prince of Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Ayahito.
He was the first Prince of Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Ayahito.

sen.j: 母は滋野井公澄女藤原直子。
sen.e: His mother was Kinzumi SHIGENORI's daughter, FUJIWARA no Naoko.
sen.cmt: 藤原直子→FUJIWARA no Naoko [読み方確認できず]
sen.e: His mother was Kinzumi SHIGENORI's daughter, FUJIWARA no Naoko.
His mother was Kinzumi SHIGENOI's daughter, FUJIWARA no Naoko.
His childhood 's name was Wakamiya.
His childhood name was Wakamiya.
His childhood name was Wakamiya.

sen.j: 宝永5年（1708年）12月東山天皇の猶子となり、茶々丸（ちゃちゃまる）の名を賜る。
sen.e: He became Emperor Higashiyama's adopted child in December 1708 and was given the name of Chachamaru.
He became Emperor Higashiyama's adopted child in December 1708 and was given the name of Chachamaru.
He became Emperor Higashiyama's adopted child in December 1708 and was given the name of Chachamaru.

sen.j: 翌宝永6年（1709年）4月親王宣下を受け、家仁と命名される。
sen.e: He received to title to become Imperial Prince in April and named Yakahito.
He received title to become Imperial Prince in April 1709 and was named Yakahito.
He received title to become Imperial Prince in April 1709 and was named Yakahito.

sen.j: 正徳 3年（1713年）12月元服し、式部省に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He had coming-of-age ceremony in December 1713 and was appointed as Shikibushi. (the Ministry in charge of ceremonies).
He had a coming-of-age ceremony in December 1713 and was appointed as Shikibushi (the Minister in charge of ceremonies).
He had a coming-of-age ceremony in December 1713 and was appointed as Shikibusho (the Minister in charge of ceremonies).

sen.j: 享保5年（1720年）関白鷹司兼熙の女基子（尚君）と結婚する。
sen.e: He married to Motoko, who was the Chancellor, Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter(尚君).
sen.cmt: 尚君→[読み方確認できず]
sen.e: He married Motoko, who was the Chancellor, Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter(尚君) in 1720.
He married Motoko (尚君), who was the Chancellor, Kanehiro TAKATSUKASA's daughter in 1720.
sen.cmt: スペース補足。括弧位置訂正。尚君→[読み方確認できず]

sen.j: 享保9年（1724年）二品に叙せられる。
sen.e: He received Nihon (the second of Imperial Prince's ranks) in 1724.
He received Nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince) in 1724.
He received Nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince) in 1724.

sen.j: 明和4年（1767年）12月3日一品に叙せられるが、同月6日没。
sen.e: He received Ippon (the first of Imperial Prince's ranks) on December 3, 1767.
He received Ippon (the first rank for an Imperial Prince) on December 3, 1767.
He received Ippon (the first rank for an Imperial Prince) on January 22, 1768, however he died on 25 of the same month.
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。「同月6日没。」訳抜け

sen.e: He was sixty five years old.
He was sixty five years old.
He was sixty five years old.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Gokeikoin.
sen.cmt: 後桂光院→Gokeikoin [読み方確認できず]
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name was Gokeikoin.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Gokeikoin.

sen.j: 王子女に京極宮公仁親王の他、知恩院宮尊峰入道親王、一乗院宮尊映入道親王、豊子女王（有馬頼僮室）などがいる。
sen.e: His Princesses are Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Kinhito, Chioninnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Sonpo, Ichijoinnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Sonei, Princess Toyoko. (Yoriyuki ARIMA's Empress)
His Princesses are Kyogokunomiya Imperial Prince Kinhito, Chioninnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Sonpo, Ichijoinnomiya priest-Imperial Prince Sonei, Princess Toyoko. (Yoriyuki ARIMA's Empress)

His Princes and Proncesses are Imperial Prince Kyogokunomiya Kinhito, priestly Imperial Prince Chioninnomiya Sonpo, priestly Imperial Prince Ichijoinnomiya Sonei, Princess Toyoko (Yoriyuki ARIMA's Empress).
sen.cmt: 王子女→Princes and Proncesses改行削除。表記訂正しました。括弧位置訂正。
